channel.title: What threat do malicious TOR relays pose to Whonix users and are whonix gateway hops the same as browser hops in Workstation?
channel.description:
For reference google:
> how-malicious-tor-relays-are-exploiting-users-in-2020-part-i-1097575c0cac
> tracking-one-year-of-malicious-tor-exit-relay-activities-part-ii-85c80875c5df
> is-kax17-performing-de-anonymization-attacks-against-tor-users-42e566defce8
It seems that there is a large amount of malicious relays, entry and exit nodes operating on TOR network which allow deanonymization of users.
How does this affect Whonix users? And how to protect against this?
Also: do hops used for Gateway to route system traffic via TOR match the hops that TOR is running through on the Workstation instance?
Or is traffic routed once via TOR on Gateway and then a second time whenever you run TOR separately on the workstation?

item.title: What threat do malicious TOR relays pose to Whonix users and are whonix gateway hops the same as browser hops in Workstation?
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
entrancediscussion:

How does this affect Whonix users?

Unless Vanguards - Whonix helps, Tor issues affect Whonix the same way Tor issues affects Tor users since Whonix is based on Tor.

entrancediscussion:

And how to protect against this?

Whonix – 17 Nov 21

Information Booster might be Available!

Utilizing other resources to help solve questions/issues unspecific to Whonix ™.

entrancediscussion:

Also: do hops used for Gateway to route system traffic via TOR match the hops that TOR is running through on the Workstation instance?

Whonix – 23 Nov 21

Dev/anon-ws-disable-stacked-tor

Preventing Tor over Tor for Tor Browser, TorChat and others.

Read full topic
item.source: What threat do malicious TOR relays pose to Whonix users and are whonix gateway hops the same as browser hops in Workstation?
